docs.title: SmartPAL Instructor Guide
docs.text:
SmartPAL is an AI-powered learning support platform designed to enhance student engagement and learning performance while empowering instructors with data-driven, AI-powered insights and productivity tools.

SmartPAL integrates with Canvas and supports teaching and learning through a combination of:

  • A course-contextualized AI chatbot designed to support self-regulated learning
  • AI-Guided Assignments that promote critical thinking and autonomy in human-AI collaboration
  • Built-in structured reflection and metacognitive prompts
  • Gamification for sustained engagement
  • Instructor-facing summaries, dashboards, and AI-powered automation for routine tasks

Here is a short introduction to SmartPAL:

Using SmartPAL as Instructional Tool without Research Participation

Using SmartPAL as Instructional Tool with Research Participation

docs.title: How Does SmartPAL Interact with Students?
docs.text:
SmartPAL is designed to enhance course engagement throughout the learning lifecycle. It uses a combination of chatbot and gamification to achieve this goal.

  • Chatbot: The GenAI-powered chatbot is designed to answer student questions about the course ("pull" from students) as well as sending students reminders, updates, encouragements, and nudges ("push" to students)
  • Gamification: we use game elements such as gems, levels, avatars, and leaderboards to motivate course engagement. Our gamification system tracks and reward several engagement indicators such as on-time submission, Canvas pageviews, answering self-reflection questions, and SmartPAL app check-ins (see Appendix for more details)

The SmartPAL app consists of three main screens:

  • Dashboard: Students see current course score and upcoming dues, synced from Canvas/
  • Chatbot: Students can ask the chatbot course-related questions and receive chatbot-initiated messages
  • Leaderboard: It features top ~20% most-engaged students based on the weekly or accumulated gems.

docs.title: How Does SmartPAL Interact with Instructors?
docs.text:
• A weekly report via email with information such as (A sample email):
    • Current Score
    • Course Goal
    • Days since last activity
    • Hours on Canvas (all time)
    • Pageviews of this week
    • Gems received this week
    • Gems received all time
  • An instructor portal: A web-based instructor portal with live student progress information and more ways to view such information and interact with SmartPAL.

docs.title: Before The Term Starts
docs.text:
1. Giving SmartPAL Access to Your Canvas Course.
    • We ask you to add SmartPAL (smartpal@umn.edu) as an Teacher to your course. This gives us access to your course, and we can use this teacher role to retrieve course and student information using Canvas API, and make updates such as upload SmartPAL related documents and grades.
    • Occasionally, we may add one or two members of the team as an observer or TA.
  2. Determine the Participation Incentives: Because we need students to complete weekly reflection, and a prey-survey (at the beginning of the semester) and a post survey (at the end). We usually recommend some participation incentives to complete these steps.
    • We recommend 1-2% worth of extra credit (or course credit) given to students for this research participation. That said, we can still deploy SmartPAL without credit incentives, though our past experiences indicate that students are less likely to complete the reflections or surveys.
    • Please let us know whether you are willing to offer incentives, and how much.
  3. Include Syllabus Language about SmartPAL: Include some language about SmartPAL in the syllabus, which we will share with you.
  4. (Optional) Checklist for Canvas:The follow checklist can help SmartPAL better answer student questions.
    • Always set due dates for deliverables such as assignments and quizzes.
    • Include descriptions for exams, quizzes, and modules (e.g. what topics do they cover, exam preparation tips etc)
    • Using a grading scheme: See a guide here, so that we can translate the Canvas course score into a letter grade.
    • Maintain the Canvas grade book to provide an accurate running total, including:
      • Ensure that every assignment has a point value assigned to enable correct grade calculation.
      • Regularly enter grades for all assignments
      • Utilize weighted assignment groups if you use weighted grading.
      • Enter "0" for missing submissions (Canvas ignores all ungraded assignments when calculating a student’s total grade, even those that are past due)
    • Offer the syllabus using Canvas's "Syllabus" function(an inline syllabus is preferred over an attachment): See a guide here.
    • For subjectively graded questions, it would be helpful to use a grading rubric: See a guide here.

docs.title: On the first day of class
docs.text: We will ask you to show some slides/a short video about SmartPAL, and encourage them to participate in this research.

docs.title: At the end of the term
docs.text: Usually, we keep smartpal-related grades updated and such grades are finalized by the last day of instruction. You may let us know if you have any question about the SmartPAL grades (deliu@umn.edu).

docs.title: What Canvas Changes Can SmartPAL Make?
docs.text:
SmartPAL is restricted to only making changes to Canvas elements that are directly related to SmartPAL.

We may make these changes on behalf of the instructor:

  • Creating a Module for SmartPAL
  • Upload or update SmartPAL related documents (User Guide, IRB Information Sheet, etc)
  • Create or update SmartPAL related assignments (e.g. filling out surveys, installing the app) with appropriate point values based on the agreed-upon participation incentives.
  • Set or change the due dates for SmartPAL related assignments
  • Create an assignment group for SmartPAL related assignments
  • Post SmartPAL-related grades
  • Email students about SmartPAL from smartpal@umn.edu
  • Add members of the SmartPAL research team as an observer or TA, only on a necessary basis.

We will not do the following:

  • We do not make any change to Canvas elements that are unrelated to SmartPAL.
  • We do not post Canvas announcement unless we have asked and gotten your permission.

docs.title: Web App and Canvas Integration
docs.text:
• Web Access: SmartPAL is now available at app.smartpal.org
  • Canvas Integration: Log into SmartPAL directly within your Canvas courses via the new Canvas plug-in.
  • Instructor Dashboard: Instructors can now view course-level data, including late submissions, reflection rates, and anonymized student questions.
  • Course Settings: Instructors can enable or disable features like leaderboards and assignment reminders for each course.

docs.title: Mobile App Updates
docs.text:
• Single Sign-On (SSO): Sign in using your institution’s login credentials — no separate account needed.
  • Custom Leaderboards: Leaderboards are now optional and can be hidden or shown based on the course setup.

docs.title: Chatbot Enhancements
docs.text:
• Faster Responses: New streaming technology delivers real-time chatbot answers, especially for cached course info.
  • Smarter Conversations: The chatbot now supports richer, more context-aware responses and can begin handling interactive quiz content.

docs.title: New Instructor Tools
docs.text:
• Reflections via Web: Students can complete weekly reflections through both the app and the new web interface.
  • Custom Messaging & Reports: Instructors receive updated dashboards and weekly digests with insights into class engagement.

  • Instructors please feel free to contact De Liu (deliu@umn.edu) directly.

docs.title: How does SmartPAL protect sensitive content?
docs.text: SmartPAL fully respects Canvas visibility settings. Unpublished or locked quizzes, assignments, and documents are not included in the SmartPAL chatbot knowledge base. Similarly, unreleased grades will not be revealed to students.

docs.title: AI Use During Assessments
docs.text: SmartPAL includes a GenAI-powered chatbot. If GenAI tools are not permitted during exams or quizzes, students should not be allowed to use SmartPAL during those assessments. We recommend communicating this policy clearly to students.

docs.text:
SmartPAL is designed to enhance course engagement throughout the learning lifecycle using a combination of AI assistance and gamification.

docs.title: Deploy SmartPAL as an Instructional Tool
Why participation incentives?
docs.text:
While students may voluntarily use SmartPAL features to support their learning, some participation in SmartPAL includes activities beyond typical course requirements, such as weekly structured reflection exercises. These reflection activities are designed to support learning through metacognitive practice, encourage deliberate engagement with course material, and provide instructors with feedback to inform instruction.

Because these activities require additional time and sustained effort across the semester, participation incentives can be used to encourage consistent reflection and meaningful engagement.

docs.title: Participation Incentive Options
docs.text:
Instructors may adopt one of the following approaches for SmartPAL participation:

  • No Credit: SmartPAL participation, including reflection activities, is entirely voluntary and does not affect course grades.
  • Extra Credit: Students may earn a small amount (e.g. ~1%) of extra credit for completing weekly reflections and other SmartPAL participation activities.
  • Course Credit: SmartPAL activities, such as weekly reflections, count toward a small portion (e.g. ~1%) of the course participation or engagement grade.

If you're already comfortable with SmartPAL and interested in contributing to AI learning research, consider the research participation mode.

docs.title: Canvas Setup
docs.text: SmartPAL automatically creates and manages Canvas elements to minimize instructor workload:

docs.title: Assignments
docs.text:
SmartPAL organizes assignments into two assignment groups:

  • SmartPAL Assignments: House SmartPAL-related assignments except weekly reflections. This keeps SmartPAL activities separate from your regular course assignments.

    • SmartPAL Post Survey (zero-credit): A very short voluntary survey at the end of the course for tool feedback and improvements.
    • SmartPAL App Activation (zero-credit): Assignment for activating SmartPAL for the course
    • SmartPAL Reflection Credit (if participation incentives are provided): Assignment for representing total reflection points
    • SmartPAL Engagement Credit (if participation incentives are provided): Assignment for representing total learning engagement points

  • SmartPAL Reflections: House weekly reflection assignments (one per eligible week).

In addition, in courses using weighted grading scheme and assigning Extra Credit for SmartPAL, a SmartPAL Extra Credit assignment may be created to represent the extra credit for SmartPAL.

docs.title: Before The Course Starts
docs.text:
Preferably at least one week before first class,

  1. Give SmartPAL Access to Your Canvas Course(s).
    • Each institution has a designated SmartPAL user account, usually "smartpal@domain-name" (e.g. smartpal@umn.edu for University of Minnesota)
    • We ask you to add SmartPAL user account as a Teacher to your course. This gives SmartPAL access to your course, allowing it to retrieve needed information for SmartPAL to function and manage the SmartPAL related Canvas items.
  2. Determine Whether to Offer Participation Incentives
    • Offering a small amount of participation credits is helpful, but optional, for sustaining participation and engagement activities that go beyond typical course requirements (such as weekly reflections).

  3. Include Syllabus Language about SmartPAL (Recommended):

    SmartPAL Learning Support

    This course offers SmartPAL, a digital learning support tool connected to our Canvas course. It helps students stay organized, reflect on their learning, receive encouragement and reminders, and get course-related learning support. Use of SmartPAL is voluntary - it does not replace course instruction or graded assessments.

    Because SmartPAL includes a generative AI–powered chatbot, its use is prohibited for any assignment, assessment, or activity in which generative AI tools are not permitted, unless explicitly authorized by the instructor.

docs.title: General Data Practice
docs.text:
SmartPAL follows strict FERPA-compliant practices:

  • No data selling
  • No data used for advertising
  • No identifiable data used to train general-purpose AI models
  • De-identified data may be retained for research (if applicable) & platform improvement
  • Identifiable student information deleted shortly after the pilot ends
  • Secure encrypted storage

docs.title: Student Privacy Protections
docs.text:
AI chat content privacy:

  • Detailed AI chat transcripts are not shared with instructors, TAs, administrators, or other instructional stakeholders.
  • Instructional stakeholders may receive non-identifiable, aggregate engagement indicators (e.g., overall usage counts or broad activity levels) to inform course-level instructional decisions, without access to individual chat content or prompts.

AI-guided assignment interaction privacy:

  • SmartPAL does not provide instructors, TAs, or administrators access to students’ full AI interaction transcripts (e.g., step-by-step prompts or conversational exchanges).
  • Instructors may receive student-submitted artifacts (such as drafts, revisions, or final work) only when these are explicitly part of the assignment requirements.
  • SmartPAL may generate limited, non-content activity indicators (e.g., number of interactions or general interaction length) to support instructional insights, without revealing the substance of student–AI conversations.

Peer privacy:

  • Students cannot view other students' individual data or activity.
  • Any peer-facing features (e.g., leaderboards) use anonymized or pseudonymized representations that do not reveal student identities.

Reflection visibility and boundaries:

  • Students are clearly informed that reflections submitted as part of course activities may be shared with instructors or TAs for pedagogical purposes only.
  • Any reflections explicitly designated as private are not shared with instructors, TAs, or other stakeholders.

docs.title: Why incentives are needed
docs.text: Participation in SmartPAL research includes activities beyond normal course requirements, such as weekly structured reflections and completion of background and post-study surveys. The reflection activities are designed to support learning through metacognitive practice and facilitate instructor-driven support, while also contributing to research on learning processes. Incentives are provided to fairly compensate students for the additional time and sustained effort required, to encourage consistent participation throughout the study period, and to support high-quality reflection and feedback essential for both instructional improvement and research. Participation is entirely voluntary.

docs.title: Incentive Options
docs.text:
Based on instructor preferences, research participation incentives can be set up as:

  • Extra Credit: Students earn a small amount of extra credit (e.g., ~1-2%) for participating
  • Course Credit: SmartPAL activities count toward a small portion (e.g., ~1-2%) of the regular course grade

Preferably at least one week before first class,

docs.title: Deployment Options
docs.text:
SmartPAL can be deployed in two different modes, depending on your course goals and preferences:

  • As an Instructional Tool – Use SmartPAL as a teaching and learning support tool
  • As Research Participation – Use SmartPAL as part of an approved research study on learning technologies

docs.title: Option 1: Deploy SmartPAL as Instructional Tool
docs.text:
The Instructional Tool mode allows you to use SmartPAL as a teaching and learning support tool, similar to other instructional technologies.

Key characteristics

  • No IRB involvement
  • No required surveys
  • Participation credit optional
  • Minimal instructor overhead

Best suited for

  • First-time SmartPAL users
  • Courses where participation credit or research framing is not desirable

Data use

  • Aggregate, de-identified usage data used for platform improvement
  • Not used for human subjects research

docs.title: Option 2: Deploy SmartPAL as Research Participation
docs.text:
The Research Participation mode allows SmartPAL to be used as part of an IRB-approved study on learning technologies.

Key characteristics

  • Covered by IRB approval (student consent exempt)
  • Voluntary participation by students
  • Background and post-course surveys
  • Participation credit required (e.g., 1-2% extra credit or course credit)
  • Low instructor overhead

Best suited for

  • Instructors interested in contributing to learning research
  • Instructors comfortable offering participation incentives

Incentives

  • A small amount of participation incentives is required to compensate students for the additional time and sustained effort required

Data use

  • De-identified data used for IRB-approved research
  • Aggregate, de-identified usage data used for platform improvement

docs.title: Side-by-Side Comparison
docs.text:
Instructional Tool Mode Research Participation Mode IRB Requirement None Yes Surveys None required Background and post surveys Participation Credit Optional Required Instructor Overhead Minimal Low Data Use Platform improvement only IRB-approved learning research Best For First-time users; courses where research framing is not desirable Instructors interested in contributing to learning research

👉 Continue with the Instructional Tool Mode if your primary goal is to support student learning with minimal additional requirements.

👉 Continue with the Research Participation Mode if you are interested in contributing to evidence-based insights on AI-supported learning.

Not Sure Which Option Is Right?

  • Most instructors start with the Instructional Tool Mode and later choose to participate in research after gaining experience with SmartPAL.
  • You are welcome to discuss options with the SmartPAL team before deciding.
